titleStmt.title: VVestward for smelts. Or, the vvater-mans fare of mad-merry vvestern wenches whose tongues albeit like bell-clappers, they neuer leaue ringing, yet their tales are svveet, and will much content you. VVriten by Kinde Kit of Kingstone.
titleStmt.author: Kinde Kit, of Kingstone.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by G. Purslowe] for Iohn Trundle, and are to be sold at his shop in Barbican, at the signe of the No-body,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Barbican, at the signe of the No-body
